subtitle: the lives of Lincoln assassination conspirator Tom Harbin and Charlie Russell
title: Confederate spies at large
subjects: Booth, John Wilkes, -- 1838-1865 -- Friends and associates

by_statement: John Stewart ; foreword by Roy Z. Chamlee, Jr

description.value: "This is the story of two Confederate spies, Tom Harbin and Charlie Russell. It was Harbin who left a getaway horse for Booth, and Harbin who helped Booth escape across the Potomac. The other half of this book presents a new Confederate spy: Tom Harbin's step-cousin Charlie Russell"--Provided by publisher
